The highly acclaimed release was the first opportunity for a worldwide audience to witness her mesmerizing talents as an instrumentalist, vocalist and composer. The New York Times raved, Esperanza Spalding has got a lot: accomplished jazz improvisation, funk, scat singing, Brazilian vernacular rhythm and vocals in English, Portuguese and Spanish. At its center is a female bassist, singer and bandleader, one whose talent is beyond question. Soon after release, Esperanza Spalding went straight to the top of Billboard's Contemporary Jazz chart where it remained for over 70 weeks.
